text: from Dork done these days whether you're
kayaking or cooking dinner it seems that
you are not truly living unless you're
documenting every minute of it GoPro
started the trend towards small rugged
take anywhere cameras and they're still
going strong with three new models the
cheapest one is a hundred and thirty
dollars but the really sexy ones start
at four hundred bucks and pack in the
features so as GoPro gets a little more
Pro competitors are nipping at its heels
with cheaper cameras that are easier to
use one of those options is the polaroid
cube which costs $99 so the question is
if you're not a pro surfer or an X Games
athlete are you really going to use all
those extra features I compared the
GoPro Hero 4 with the polaroid cube to
find out now at first that feels a
little unfair because the GoPro Hero 4
is stacked the silver model starts at
four hundred dollars the gopro hero4
black is five hundred dollars they both
shoot in 4k and have built-in Wi-Fi and
Bluetooth and all of these onboard
editing and highlight tagging features
plus GoPro offers a free mobile app that
lets you remotely control the cameras
and downloadable software for editing
the video you take into super cool
looking movies and then there's the
polaroid cube it has one-button
operation you press the button once to
take a photograph and twice to take a
video it takes HD video and 6 megapixel
stills and that's about it the design is
attractive and durable and great for
kids hi both cameras offer a lot of
optional accessories for mounting them
to helmets or ski poles or bicycles I
will say that I tried out the polaroid
cubes waterproof case and I found that
it just didn't fit quite right the
camera actually rattled around in there
and I could hear it in my video
in some ways the free GoPro mobile app
is wonderful it lets you remotely
control the camera you can add a
highlight tag and you can access
settings on your phone instead of
pressing the buttons on the camera but I
found that it disconnected from the
camera a lot and it seemed to drain the
battery life big time in terms of image
quality the GoPro has always been the
king and that isn't changing although
the differences are not that dramatic
GoPro video definitely has better
resolution and it deals with motion
better but the cube has nice bright
colors GoPros still pictures are
definitely higher quality than the cubes
so which one are you gonna choose if
you're really into extreme sports and
making cool videos and the universe of
accessories and the cachet that comes
from the name definitely get a GoPro but
if you're into durability ultra
simplicity and affordability the cube is
great you can give it to your kids you
can stick it on the fridge with that
little magnet and it looks really good
let's face it most of us I'm not gonna
go pro we're gonna go full ride
